title: Post card dated 1906; Correspondence between Scotland and the US
content:
Please help ID the Peace an Prosperity font

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Post card.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/typophile.com/files/Post%20card.jpg) | 879.33 KB |
author: tracieEB

comments.content:
Your sample was hand-lettered; it's not a typeface.

Though I couldn't find any close matches, the fonts below evoke the same period and feel:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/melanie/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/melanie/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/melanie/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/toulouse-lautrec-le-chat-noir/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/toulouse-lautrec-le-chat-noir/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/toulouse-lautrec-le-chat-noir/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/novella/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/novella/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/novella/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/aged/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/aged/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/aged/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/adantine/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/adantine/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/adantine/")

I love these old postcards - especially the lettering handiwork. I'd like to recommend Gert Wiescher's [Cacao](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/cacao/).

Edit: Cacao appears in the Solotype Catalog as Kingsland (Gloriosky), pg. 102.

Reminds me a bit of the less informal, but time-appropriate [Auriol](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/auriol/fonts/) and GLC's rougher version, [1906 Fantasio Auriol](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/glc/1906-fantasio-auriol/).

Oh, and then there's also the 1890's typeface [Boomerang](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.fonts.com/font/monotype/boomerang) and its bold italic version, [Regina Cursiv](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/regina/fonts/) (note the similar Toffee Script).
Boomerang and Regina Cursiv work for me....

The gestalt of this loose and creamy lettering is with Boomerang and Regina Cursiv. We can make it a trilogy by adding Karolla

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746im_/http:/typophile.com/files/KarollaNarrowBoldInUse_4433.jpg)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/karolla/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/karolla/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/karolla/")  
Don

Perhaps we can expand the blobby trinity to a foursome with Ivan Zemtsov

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IvanZemtsovInUse_3932.jpg)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/k-type/ivan-zemtsov/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717203746/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/k-type/ivan-zemtsov/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/k-type/ivan-zemtsov/")  
Don
